meanings.definition: Showing or suggesting a lofty and courageous spirit
meanings.sent1: Her magnanimous gesture of donating all her birthday money to charity impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The king's magnanimous decision to pardon the rebel leader won him admiration from his subjects.
meanings.sent3: It was quite magnanimous of the cat to share its toy mouse with the new kitten.
meanings.sent4: The sun's magnanimous rays bathed the entire valley in golden light.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's magnanimous smile encouraged the shy student to speak up in class.

meanings.definition: Generous in forgiving an insult or injury
meanings.sent1: Despite the harsh words, she remained magnanimous and forgave her friend.
meanings.sent2: He was magnanimous enough to overlook the mistake and move forward positively.
meanings.sent3: The magnanimous cat forgave the dog for knocking over its food bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her magnanimous heart allowed her to let go of grudges easily.
meanings.sent5: The magnanimous act of forgiveness brought peace to their strained relationship.

meanings.definition: Noble in mind; elevated in soul; exalted in principles
meanings.sent1: The magnanimous leader always put the needs of his people above his own.
meanings.sent2: She had a magnanimous spirit that inspired those around her to be better.
meanings.sent3: It was quite magnanimous of the tree to provide shade for the weary travelers.
meanings.sent4: The magnanimous mountain stood tall, offering protection to the valley below.
meanings.sent5: His magnanimous ideals guided him to always do what was right, no matter the cost.
